sentence.Network_en: Such a motion is considered a test of backbench opinion.
sentence.Network_cn: 这样的动议被视为对后座议员立场的考验。

sentence.Network_en: The Prime Minister has caved in to backbench pressure.
sentence.Network_cn: 首相迫于后座议员们的压力让步了。

sentence.Network_en: The wisdom of the retired generals and backbench MPs conjoins.
sentence.Network_cn: 退役将军和后座议员的智慧结合在一起。

PerfectNetExp.abs: backache 背痛backbench 后座议员席backbencher 后座议员
...党领袖负责的首相答问环节，这是一个通常在每周三正午12点于下议院举行的30分钟会议。在野党领袖通常会提两组共计6个问题。而其他在野党“后坐议员”（backbench）也有机会向首相提问，或通过抽签，或通过议长指派。按照惯例，除了在野党领袖之外，其馀影子内阁成员是不会在首相答问环节质询首相的。

list.abs: Edward Du Cann , Chairman of the 1922 Committee of Tory backbenchers , would throw his hat in the ring .保守党后座议员1922年委员会的主席爱德华·杜坎参加了竞
backbenchers fear the ghoulish tortures of whips and the lost chance of preferment that rudeness about the prime minister might incur .后座议员害怕残忍的鞭打刑讯和失去关于首相可能招致粗蛮的表现机会。
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(B) ... backbench 后座议员席 backbencher 后座议员 backbend 弓状姿势.

the Liberal backbencher wants the current test scrapped and replaced by a personal interview that assesses knowledge and spoken English , rather than literacy or computer skills .自由后排希望目前的测试和取消，取而代之的是一个个人采访时表示，评估的知识和英语口语，而不是识字或电脑技能。

entry.tran: 后座（议员）的;普通（议员）的
entry.def: A backbench MP is a Member of Parliament who is not a minister and who does not hold an official position in his or her political party.

example.ex: ...the Conservative backbench MP Sir Teddy Taylor...
example.tran: 保守党下院普通议员泰迪·泰勒爵士

example.ex: Such a motion is considered a test of backbench opinion.
example.tran: 这样的动议被视为对后座议员立场的考验。

means.word_mean: 1. any of the seats occupied by backbenchers in the House of Commons
